**Goals**
=========

The primary goal of this class is to enhance students’ development of their scientific writing and presentation skills. Students will develop the English reading and writing skills necessary to comprehend and produce journal articles in their specialized field. Students will also discuss and develop the skills they will need to present their research in a seminar or at an international conference.

**Materials**

Primary Textbooks

(Note: \* These books are available for download from the NTNU Library.)

\*Glasman-Deal, H. (2010). _Science Research Writing for Non-Native Speakers of English_. London: Imperial College Press.

**Requirements**

**1.  Attendance and Preparation**: This is a skill-based course. It is expected that you will attend class weekly to discuss and practice the skills that are the focus of the course. If you fail to attend or miss class frequently, it will affect your final grade. Prior to class, please prepare any assigned readings and complete any assigned tasks.

**2.  Participation**: It is expected that students will be active participants in the learning process. 

Grading

Your final grade will be based on completion of a final research paper of your own research, writing assignments from the textbook related to parts of the research paper, class presentations, other assignments, and attendance. 

Final Research Paper                                                 25%

Writing Assignments (parts of a research paper)        30%

Class Presentations (textbook & research paper)       25%

Attendance & Other Assignments                               20%
